Detailed Description

Extends the class RamData to provide an internal copy of the buffer passed by BufferedData::CreateInstance. The internal buffer is allocated in BufferedData::CreateInstance and destroyed in BufferedData::ReleaseInstance. Hence when using the class BufferedData the application-programmer may delete its buffer immediatly after invoking BufferedData::CreateInstance because the buffer is copied to the internal buffer.

BufferedData::~BufferedData (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Destroys the internal buffer for the case, that ReleaseInstance has not been invoked.

BufferedData * BufferedData::CreateInstance (  UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  length,
DrmLocalId  id = c_drm_invalid_local_id
)  [static]
 

Creates and returns an object of this class. The content of buffer is copied to an internal buffer. The internal buffer is destroyed when invoking ReleaseInstance().

void BufferedData::ReleaseInstance (   )  [virtual]
 

Destroys the internal buffer.
